title: Identify component that are most problematic in terms of differences with Figma
body:
# Feature Issue

Identify component that are most problematic in terms of differences with Figma (assigned to Erik in retro 2023-07-13)

### Description

Discussed with @ilmotta and @J-Son89 "maybe our approach could just be count the number of uses of the component in the codebase?" and "Yeah, I would say the most reusable ones are probably worth refactoring/rewriting. There are many components that are used just once, in one particular screen, maybe those are not as important for now" "so I think just going through the uses as defined by quo.core.cljs of the components like this will help us figure out what is priority and what's not."

```clojure
(ns quo2.count
  "save as src/quo2/count.clj and execute in repl"
  (:require [clojure.string :as str]
            [clojure.java.io :as io]))

(defn get-component-names [text]
  (->> (re-seq #"\(def [^\s\)]+" text)
       (map #(str/replace % #"\(def " ""))
       (map #(str "quo/" %))))

(defn search-in-file [filename name]
  (when (and (str/ends-with? filename ".cljs")
             (not (str/includes? filename "quo_preview")))
    (let [file-content (slurp filename)]
      (when (.contains file-content name)
        [filename (count (re-seq (re-pattern (str "\\b" name "\\b")) file-content))]))))

(defn search-in-project [name]
  (let [results (->> (file-seq (io/file "./src/status_im2"))
                     (map #(.toString %))
                     (map #(search-in-file % name))
                     (remove nil?))]
    {name {:count (reduce + (map second results))
           :occurrences results}}))

(def text (slurp "./src/quo2/core.cljs"))
(def names (get-component-names text))
(def results (map search-in-project names))
(->> results
     (apply merge)
     (sort-by (comp :count val) >))
```
which returns (not 100% accurate, since components sometimes are prefaced with quo2/, etc. but good enough for a rough comparison)
